- Resource cards provide tokens and are then Discarded.
- Bonus Cards are placed face-up in front of the owner and provide either a continuous benefit or are discarded for a one-time benefit.

At the start of the game each player gets 10 PT, 10 LT and 10 ST. A player mater is utilised to track the status of the tribe and indicate how the PT are being utilised throughout the game.

The game is conducted over six turns with each turn comprising 9 phases as follows:
1. Season Phase
- Place 7 x no. of players cards from the top of the spirit deck face up.
2. Braves Phase
- Players take turns activating Population Tokens one at a time. An activated PT can hunt (claim a face up spirit card) or go on a raid or go trading.
3. Hunt Phase
- Resolve Spirit Card purchases and conversions as soon as they are claimed. Some Spirit Cards have a purchase cost in tokens. This must be paid immediately. If the purchase cost cannot be paid, the card cannot be claimed. If the Spirit Card is a resource card, immediately gain the indicated type of tokens and then discard the card.
4. Territory Phase
- If you have more LT than PT, gain FT equal to the difference.
- If you have less LT than PT, lose FT equal to the difference.
5. Food Phase
- Each player discards FT equal to their PT.
- If they are short then roll once on a Starvation Table for each FT they are short and resolve results.
6. Raid Phase
- Players take turns conducting Raids.
- Each PT held in reserve conducts its own raid.
- When making a Raid, declare the target of the Raid:
Target Opponent, Non-player Tribe, or White Men.
- Roll for results on the appropriate raid table and resolve accordingly.
7. Trade Phase
- Players may trade Tokens with each other or with white men (using set conversion rates)
8. Encroachment Phase
- Each player rolls once on an Encroachment Table and resolves results accordingly.
9. Spirit Phase
- All unclaimed face-up Spirit Cards are discarded.

The game is played over six turns. At the end of the 6th turn scoring is conducted as follows:
Player with most LT gets 10 VP
Player with most PT gets 9 VP
Player with most HT gets 8 VP
Player with most WT gets 7 VP
Player with most ST gets 6 VP
Player with most CT gets 5 VP
Player with most TT gets 3 VP
Player with most FT gets 2 VP
Player with the most Bonus Cards get 4 VP
If tied in a category, all tied players get the points -1.

The player with the most Victory Points (VP) at the end of the game wins.

If at any point during the game a player loses all his Population Tokens or Land Tokens he automatically loses.

227129.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Squirrel Girl Promo Pack
227129.description:
Flavor text:

Kick Butts, Eat Nuts

Card Text:

While Squirrel Girl is active, at the end of your turn, add a squirrel counter to this card. During your turn, when you may use a Global Ability, you may remove a squirrel counter and place a squirrel token with 1A and 1D into the Field Zone. You may have up to 4 Squirrel tokens in the Field Zone at once.

227130.name: Nihon and the City of Edo
227130.description:
From publisher blurb:

A source book that allows players and GMs to expand their Honour campaigns into the mysterious and exciting Land of the Rising Sun! Nihon (Pangu's equivalent to our Japan) is a land of mist filled valleys, mega-cities and giant robots! Who wouldn't want to go there?

227131.name: Assassin Techniques: The Integration Cold Tech Tree
227131.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blend into society with the Integration cold technique tree!

Interjection Games' assassin (nominated for Endzeitgeist's top 10 products of 2016) is a hybrid "momentum" class. A momentum class builds up something akin to combo points by performing various small techniques, which it can then spend as currency to power medium and large abilities. This offers significantly more granularity than similar systems, as some techniques spend 1 point, others up to 4, and still others have addons or other sliding scale mechanisms that makes their point cost a conscious choice of the player. As a hybrid, the assassin's techniques are split into hot and cold categories. Hot techniques use the aforementioned combo point system, cold techniques draw from a ki-style technique pool, and some lukewarm techniques can draw from combo points or the technique pool.

This expansion introduces the integration cold technique tree, which focuses on blending into society, establishing an inner circle of friends and allies, and mental conditioning that helps you live with the fact that you kill people for a living.

Techniques

Civilian Contacts - Create one of 11 types of NPC in a town. This NPC is your ally and will help you with jobs in that town. For every four integration techniques you know, gain another NPC.
Contact Shuffle - One of your ally NPCs can move to a new town every 3 months.
Cover Story - Learn a little magic to help conceal your identity.
Crazy Eyes - Demoralize creatures with the Intimidate skill as a swift action.
Deadened Nerves - You've seen it all. Fear is nothing.
Investigate Mark - Declare a creature to be your mark, gaining temporary technique points that can only be used against it. At high level, you gain more temporary technique points that can only be used against a close companion of the mark, such as a hound, bodyguard, or spouse.
Killer's Ritual - Protect yourself from a single alignment.
Memento - Take souvenirs from your kills, making resurrection difficult and notifying you immediately if resurrection is successful.
Paladin Proofing - Hide your alignment, and set up a false alignment that fools divination magic, as well as spells that affect certain alignments differently.
Plan B - If your forgeries are detected, they explode as explosive runes.
Silver-tongued Rogue - Gain a sizable luck bonus to Bluff, Diplomacy, and Intimidate.
Sweep the Room - Take 20 on a Perception check made to search a room as a full-round action.
The Watson - One of your civilian contacts is actually an assassin with an opposing build. For example, if you are an acupressure/execution/integration/intuition assassin, then your contact is an initiation/magehunting/infiltration/poison assassin. Your "Watson" will adventure with you in his home town.
Unfazed by Death - Immunity to sickening from scents and gory sights
Unfazed by Foulness - Immunity to inhaled poisons and SR 10 + level against death spells

227132.name: Ghost Spore Swarm
227132.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Ghost Spore Swarm CR 11
2 New Magic Items: Angry Hornet, Festering Angry Hornet
6 New Natural Items: Ghost Ale, Glacier Toad Hide, Leng Spider Eye, Salamander Tonic, Slurk Grease, Tenebrous Worm Paint Brush

227133.name: Indus Valley
227133.description:
A card game for 2-7 players.

Each player represents a city of the Bronze Age Indus Valley Civilization (IVC), also known as the Harappan Culture. The IVC flourished (in present day Pakistan) 3300 - 1300 BCE.

The game is conducted over 10 turns. Each turn represents 200 years.

Players share a common deck. Each card has the trait of one or more scoring categories of seven different types:
1. Farming
2. Animals
3. Materials
4. Products
5. Trade
6. Building
7. Culture

Each turn has 4 Phases:
1. Draw Phase
- Each player draws 3 cards OR fills their hand to 7 cards.
2. Trade Phase
- Players may trade Cards and Points with each other. Trades do not have to be equal.
3. Meld Phase
- Each player may make 1 or more melds in this phase. A meld must consist of 3 or more cards in the same category. A meld scores points in that category equal to the square of the number of cards in the meld.
4. End Phase
- Max hand size is 5. Discard excess cards.

At the end of the game each player looks at his 7 point categories. A player's final score is equal to his score in his lowest scoring category. The player with the highest final score wins.

227136.name: Italia 1990
227136.description:
From cover (Amiga release)
ITALY 1990... A TRUE WORLD CUP SIMULATION!! It's ALL there... Throw-ins, Penalties, Free Kicks, Fouls, Corners! AND... FULL CIRCUIT TRAINING, 100m Sprints, Dribbling, Press ups, Sit ups, Squat Thrusts, Weights and more! THE GREATEST FOOTBALL EVENT in the WORLD!

227139.name: Snapper
227139.description:
Snapper is a clone of the Namco arcade game Pac-Man programmed by Jonathan Griffiths for the BBC Micro and released as one of the launch titles for Acornsoft in 1982. It was later released as one of Acornsoft's launch titles for the Acorn Electron in 1983.
Acorn Electron version showing the redesigned characters

In development, the game was titled Puc Man (the first Japanese title of the arcade game was Puck Man) but the name was changed before release to avoid legal action. However, the initial release of the game was so close to Pac-Man (including the design of the game's characters) that this version had to be withdrawn and re-released with the characters changed. The player's character became a round yellow face with very short legs wearing a green cowboy hat and the ghosts became skinny humanoid monsters.

As in Pac-Man, bonus items such as fruit would sometimes appear in the centre of the screen. The highest-scoring bonus item was an acorn, a reference to the publishers. When Snapper was killed, he would shrink and turn into small lines pointing in all directions.

The main difference in gameplay between Pac-Man and Snapper is the behaviour of the ghosts (or monsters). In Pac-Man, each ghost has its own personality and follows set patterns for each level. The red ghost also travels at double speed after a certain number of dots are eaten. In Snapper, the monsters begin each level by patrolling their corners a set number of times before breaking from their route to chase the Snapper. The time before breaking the route is reduced for each level until on later levels, the monsters chase Snapper almost immediately. The only real difference between the monsters is the corner they patrol and how soon they break from their route (e.g. the red ghost is always the first). Also, in Pac-Man, the main character slows when eating dots (so ghosts can catch up to him) but this does not happen in Snapper. These changes lead to a game which is much easier in the early levels but gets progressively more difficult so games tend to last longer.

The game ran very smoothly, making it a popular release of the time. As it was written in machine code, rather than BASIC, it was much closer to the arcade version than earlier commercial releases on the BBC Micro such as Micro Power's Munchyman.

Snapper was also noted for starting the BBC Micro tradition of controlling arcade games using the Z, X, : and / keys for horizontal and vertical motion, since on most BBC models the arrow keys were not conveniently placed for gaming.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snapper_%28video_game%29 Snapper (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

227140.name: S.D. Hiryu no Ken Densetsu
227140.description:
An updated version of the game, entitled SD Hiryū no Ken Densetsu (SD飛龍の拳伝説 "SD Legend of the Fist of the Flying Dragon"?), was released in Japan only, adding more characters (such as Jack, Ryu, and Gofire from the Super Chinese series), items and a new gameplay mode. It also removed the more realistic "Virtual Mode", favoring the super deformed "Quest Mode".[2]
Playable characters are Ryuhi, Hayato, Min Min, Wiler, Shouryu, Yuka, Suzaku, Powers, Robo No Hana, Bokuchin (unlockable), Jack, Ryu, Raima, E. Quaker, Ellie, Gofire, Ryumaou (unlockable).

Wiki link:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flying_Dragon#S.D._Hiryu_no_Ke...

227143.name: 1867: The Railways of Canada
227143.description:
1867: The Railways of Canada is an investment and railway operations game. The map represents the central part of Canada, consisting of the southern part of the provinces of Ontario and Quebec. It is a member of the 18xx family. The game takes many features from the earlier 1861: Railways of the Russian Empire, but adds some new features.

The key new features are:
a) There are no fixed positions for the minor companies, you choose a start position when you put up a minor for auction.
b) The State Railway doesn't run its trains and save up for another, but rather just takes the next new train each round. This speeds up the game a little in comparison to 1861, and also accelerates the trains somewhat.

This game was originally released as an expansion for 1861, but is now available as a complete stand-alone game.

227144.name: $Greed
227144.description: Casino-like dice game with felt layout. Six dice each have the letters to spell $greed on them. Players roll once, choose the best dice and reroll the rest, (like Yathzee) Various scores are given for rolling different combinations with the highest (1000) going to full spelling of $greed with 2 different colored "e's" First player to reach 5000 wins.

227145.name: GreenGreenerGreenest
227145.description:
Green is the first game of the Green-Greener-Greenest set. Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Green is a game for 3 players derived from The House of the Flying Blades and brother game of RED and BLUE, by the same designer, that uses a non-transitive capturing mechanism.

Depending on the set, you’d have:

Basic: a 6 x 6 board, 15 black pyramids, 20 green pyramids, 15 white pyramids.

Advanced: a 6x9-9x9 board (using one or both pads), 30 black pyramids, 45 green pyramids, 30 white pyramids.

Gameplay overview:

The board starts full of pyramids. Players in turn capture (mandatory) other pyramids or stacks of pyramids orthogonally so that:

- Black can only capture Green
- Green can only capture White
- White can only capture Black

The game ends when all players pass in succession. The player with the highest combined height of controlled stacks wins the game.

Please refer to the rulebook for detailed rules.


Greener is the second game of the Green-Greener-Greenest set. Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Greener is a capturing game for 2 players, where both must capture the same colour.

Depending on the set, you’d have:

Basic: a 6 x 6 board, 15 black pyramids, 20 green pyramids, 15 white pyramids.

Advanced: a 6x9-9x9 board (using one or both pads), 30 black pyramids, 45 green pyramids, 30 white pyramids.

Gameplay overview:

The board starts full of pyramids. Players take turns capturing pyramids or stacks of any colour orthogonally.

The game ends when all players pass in succession. The player with the most green pyramids captured (being part of stacks they control) wins the game. In case of a tie, the player with the highest stack wins. If the tie persists, play again.

Please refer to the rulebook for detailed rules.

---

Greenest is a solo game.

Setup the board as in Green. The goal of the game is to end up with a single stack, by making captures also as in Green (Black can only capture Green and so on), but in any order. This is, you can capture several times with the same colour, or reverse the order.

Whether all initial configurations are solvable or not still remains an open question. Your feedback on this will be greatly appreciated.

227146.name: Warriors of the Hikari Makuya
227146.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark force is rising to destroy the peaceful islands of the Hikari Makuya, the Shogunate of Light. Brave warriors have gathered to fight this threat, including a noble nagaji samurai, a tricky kitsune ninja, a minuscule ratfolk kensai, an ancient samsaran wu-jen (witch), and an evasive vanara monk. These five heroes from the far east, all 5th level, are ready to join your Pathfinder Role-playing Game compatible campaign!

227147.name: The Cascadia Adventures Second Edition
227147.description:
From publisher blurb:

Join the crew of the MV Dust Runner as they face danger and intrigue across the Cascadia Subsector!

The Cascadia Adventures features the original Gypsy Knights Games adventure series updated for use with Clement Sector:The Rules and The Cepheus Engine! Included are all three of the Cascadia Adventures from our PDF series.

Save Our Ship - A "whale ship". That's what the casinos on Chance call a starship sent to ferry back a wealthy gambler. The Razz Casino dispatched their "whale ship", Royal Flush, to pick up an influential politician on Roskilde. However, something has gone wrong. Now the casino has hired you to find out what has happened.

The Lost Girl – Journey to the Gagnon system to locate the lost daughter of a personal friend of The Razz Casino’s owner. Has she been kidnapped? Murdered? Turned to a life of crime? It is up to you to find out the truth.

Fled – An employee of the Razz Casino has stolen a large amount of money and fled from the Chance system to the Cascadia system. Is he a mad genius? Or is the theft of millions of credits only part of a detailed plan to change the status quo on one of the most powerful worlds in the subsector?

227148.name: Creatures & Monsters (RMSS)
227148.description:
From publisher blurb:

Encounter dragons, sprites, gorgons, saber tooth tigers and foes of all stripes, spots and scales. Even a herd of elephants or a leviathan dragon is not too big for ICE's comprehensive bestiary for Rolemaster. This is a compendium of information and statistics for two key elements of fantasy role playing: creatures and encounters.

227150.name: Zone Runners
227150.description:
Description from the designer:

Set in the near future (as imagined 70 years ago), Zone Runners is the number one show on TV. Each week a team of three contestants tries to complete a Level by running along narrow pathways that hover high in the sky. The better they perform, the more credits they win.
At random intervals gaps appear in these tracks, over which
players must jump, or otherwise fall onto the pathway below. And
large mutant creatures, known as Blockers, are also waiting to try to stop their progress.

The aim of this solitaire micro game is to win as many credits as you can!
Each Level consists of 3 tracks (high, mid and low), divided into 7 Zones (cards). The game has 3 Levels, each getting progressively more difficult.
Runners who successfully reach a Level’s End Zone are awarded points (credits), depending on the height of track and the Level. A runner who completes one Level can then tackle the next one (hopefully with their other team mates if they also finished it).
You control a team of 3 Runners. You’ll be rolling dice and deciding how best to assign them so that each Runner has the best chance of progressing. Runners also have special abilities that can modify their dice score.

Zone Runners is an entry in the 2017 9-card Nanogame PnP Design Contest.

227152.name: Nine Homeworlds
227152.description:
Nine Homeworlds is a 9-Card Nanogame, in which the players assume the role of norse clan leaders who want to collect as much glory as possible before the end of the worlds approaches. Dice rolling and tactical movement are just as important as wise calculation of the enemies' possibilities to gather as much glory as possible before the game ends.

Players roll a die and choose whether they want to move one of their heroes to another world or quest a world they are currently at. By moving into better positions, players try to gain maximum points from questing.

227153.name: Ward's Warrens: Volume 1
227153.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of hand-drawn maps for home use, licensed under creative commons.

rpg: For Gold & Glory: Old School Roleplaying
227154.name: Special Area: The Ranger's Hideout
227154.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure supplement for solo Rangers, small groups, or for a player wanting ideas for a hideout for their character.
...
Most shun the wilderness, fearful of its wild tangles and unknowns. But the wilderness can be your best friend–embracing you in its shadows, providing resources for weapons, and terrain for strategy to overcome your enemies. But if all that fails, pup, always remember... it’s ok to run!

227157.name: Call of Duty: WWII
227157.description:
Gameplay-wise, WWII is the first title since the original Call of Duty to not feature health regeneration in the campaign. Instead, players must rely on their medic squadmates to provide health packs, as well as other squad members to provide ammunition.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Call_of_Duty%3A_WWII Call of Duty: WWII]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

227158.name: FIFA 18
227158.description:
User Summary

The Journey will return in FIFA 18 with all new storylines and characters.

227159.name: Madden NFL 18
227159.description:
User Summary

Madden 18 is switching to Frostbite.

227160.name: NBA LIVE 18
227160.description:
User Summary

NBA Live 18, the first entry in the once-dominating sports game.

227161.name: Sonic Forces
227161.description:
Sonic Forces features similar gameplay to that of Sonic Generations: Modern Sonic's stages are based around three-dimensional movement like that of Sonic Unleashed and Sonic Colors, with Sonic capable of using techniques such as boosting and the homing attack, while Classic Sonic's stages will feature 2D-sidescrolling gameplay similar to the original Genesis titles.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_Forces Sonic Forces]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

227162.description:
Six rookie fireworks cats have worked very hard to let everyone see the best fireworks in the world. They hope that one day they can be an expert like their master. After so many years, the day is coming…

In Fireworks, players use the fireworks barrel to launch the fireworks dice into the starry sky box turn after turn. If the fireworks tiles land face up, the player can take a number of fireworks tiles equal to the number shown on the dice, then place them on "My Sky" boards. Whoever scores the highest points wins.
227162.name: Fireworks

227164.name: Fische Versenken
227164.description:
Fische Versenken is a card based reaction game about helping fish to escape form the glass into the ocean.

Depending on the task determined by a card, players have to combine two cards (with holes in them) in a way that you can see a fish through the hole, or that the holes in both cards are in the same position.

The fastes player to fulfill this tasks shouts "Fisch Versenkt" and scores a point.
After the draw pile is exhausted, the player with the most points wins.

227166.name: The Nyctomancer's Handbook
227166.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Nyctomancer’s Handbook is an expansion to the Dark sphere from the Spheres of Power magic system. Inside these pages you’ll find new talents, new feats, new rules, new monster templates, and more for making the most of Dark magic in your games.

227167.name: Town of Dover
227167.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something is amiss in Dover, New Hampshire, and with each passing day, the chaos builds.

Town of Dover is a full-length Scenario for Beyond the Firelight. It is set in 18th century New England, starting June 22, 1705. The Scenario spans fifteen Acts and introduces a few new mechanics to Beyond the Firelight.

The only question is, can you survive?

227172.name: Neues Deutches Flaggen-Spiel
227172.description:
This is a dice-throwing gambling game with a fairly elaborate board. The board consists of a 100-space track divided into three areas.

The outer ring consists of 26 squares around the edge of the board, each showing the flag of a German royal realm, princedom, grand duchy or duchy, as well as those of the free cities Lubeck, Bremen and Hamburg and the (recently conquered) territory of Alsace-Lorraine. The second ring consists of small squares numbered 27-82 in a variety of colors including light and dark blue, red, green, yellow and white. The final ring is a circle numbered 83-99 which sits at the center of the board flanked on either side by soldiers on horseback and above and below by the rules. The 100 space is a coat of arms in the middle of the circle.

Players each start with the same amount of money and put an agreed sum into the pot. They take turns rolling a single die to move along the track. Players need to know the ranks of the various flags: they receive 3 marks from the pot when landing on a royal or duchy space, but must put 3 marks into the pot when landing on a princedom or grand duchy. The free city squares have no effect. Landing on the same space as another player also has no effect.

Landing on Alsace-Lorraine (12) or on the squares 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 means going back to square 1 and starting over. A player who runs out of money is no longer allowed to play. Whoever gets to the 100 space first collects the pot.

227173.name: Old Dragon Day 2015: Fuga nas Terras Bárbaras
227173.description:
From Introduction:

No continente de Ryanon, a única liberdade real possível é a do pensamento, e até mesmo essa pode ser manipulada pelos habilidosos. Refugiados de diversas cidades e vilas tentam escapar do horror e miséria da guerra, e muitos são os que acabam mortos ou escravizados.

A aventura começa com os personagens capturados, desarmados e desamparados. Os íbanos, povo alto e forte do leste, são conhecidos por suas práticas escravocráticas que cobrem todo o continente. Procurando em vários cantos de Ryanon, os íbanos capturam todos aqueles que julgam lucrativos, ou ao menos úteis em seus trabalhos.

Após semanas aprisionados, os personagens avistam os Montes Tolgari, um território selvagem e perigoso, repleto de goblins e criaturas vis. Nada disso parecia um problema para os escravistas, determinados a seguirem em direção à Baía Tolgari, rumando então ao Império Hecato, a nação mais rica e autoritária do continente.

O que eles não contavam era com um ataque repentino dos bárbaros locais do clã Urso, guerreiros potentes e territorialistas, inimigos de qualquer um que julguem invasores de seu domínio.


Translation courtesy of Google:

On Ryanon's continent, the only real freedom possible is that of thought, and even this can be manipulated by the skilled. Refugees from various cities and towns try to escape the horror and misery of war, and many are the ones who end up dead or enslaved.

The adventure begins with characters captured, disarmed and helpless. The Ibo, a tall and strong people from the east, are known for their slave practices that cover the entire continent. Searching in various corners of Ryanon, the Ibanos capture all those who find it profitable, or at least useful in their work.

After weeks imprisoned, the characters see the Tolgari Mountains, a wild and dangerous territory, full of goblins and vile creatures. None of this seemed to be a problem for the slaveowners, who were determined to go to Tolgari Bay, then to the Hecato Empire, the richest and most authoritarian nation on the continent.

What they did not count was a sudden onslaught of the local barbarians of the Bear clan, powerful warriors and territorialists, enemies of anyone they deem to be invaders of their domain.

227174.name: Space Battle
boardgamefamily: Goldmerk Games Travel Games for Smart Kids
227174.description:
Battleship version on hexgrid with spaceships.

Each player deploys his spaceships secretly on a hex grid. Then each player shoots at the other's grid by calling a location. The defender responds by "Hit!" or "Miss!". You try to deduce where the enemy ships are and sink them. First to do so wins.

227175.name: Nugget
227175.description:
Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces! A Fistful of Family Card Games.

The game is played over multiple rounds.

Each round, the deck is shuffled and each player is dealt one card. The rest of the cards are placed in the middle of the table in a face down stack.

Each turn, a player draws either the top card from the deck or a card from the centre (if there are any). If they drew a card from the deck, they may discard it to the centre and draw another from the deck (which they must keep).

This occurs until everyone has seven cards in hand.

From those seven cards, each player builds their best five card poker hand and is awarded points based on the strength of that poker hand.

Whoever has the most points, after all the rounds are played out, wins.

227176.name: Old Dragon Day 2016: Maldição na Garra da Mantícora
227176.description:
From Introduction:

Benvindo a mais um Old Dragon Day! Esta é a aventura oficial do #odday16, para 4 a 6 personagens de 3º nível. Em uma história de pirataria com toques de horror, os aventureiros investigam um navio amaldiçoado para obter seus tesouros e destruir um fantasma atormentado. Leia toda a aventura antes de mestrar para os jogadores, e caso deseje, use os personagens prontos disponibilizados no site da Redbox na semana anterior ao evento.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Welcome to another Old Dragon Day! This is the official adventure of # odday16, for 4 to 6 3rd level characters. In a history of piracy with touches of horror, the adventurers investigate a cursed ship to get their treasures and destroy a tormented ghost. Read the entire adventure before you show up for the players, and if you wish, use the ready-made characters available on the Redbox website the week before the event.

227178.name: Wer will schwarzer Peter werden?
227178.description:
Schwarzer Peter or Black Peter is the anti-Santa Claus, a character who comes along and punishes the "bad" kids while Santa doles out presents to the ones who've been good. This 19th Century gambling game uses Black Peter as a theme for a roll-and-move race with particularly nasty penalty spaces.

The board has a 70-space track, with 28 square spaces around the edge of the board, and then two concentric rings of spaces (large and illustrated 33-44, small colored spaces 45-68) with 69 and 70 along with Black Peter in the center.

The game can be played by any number and uses two dice. Anyone who rolls double 1 or 2 gets to roll again. There is an initial ante, and various spaces call for fines to be paid or bonuses received, either to/from the pot or other players. Spaces 12, 21, 25 and 28 make players go back to 5.

Anyone who lands on 35 must take the Black Peter token and is out of the game, while other spaces give players a black token - and three black tokens also eliminate the player. Any player that runs out of money along the way is eliminated too. First player to 70 collects the pot.

227180.name: Tarabish
227180.description:
Tarabish, also known by its slang term Bish, is a Scottish trick-taking card game of complex rules derived from Belote, a game of the Jass family. The actual pronunciation of the name is "tar-bish", even though it can be spelled "tarabish". It is played primarily by the people of Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, in Canada, where it was brought in 1901 by a Lebanese immigrant George Shebib.

The game is over when one or both teams accumulate 500 points or more. Points are counted at the end of each hand and both teams always count their points. The team with the most points at the end of the game wins.

A Tarabish deck consists of a normal deck of playing cards with the 2 through 5 of each suit removed. In preparation for the hand the dealer shuffles the cards in the usual manner. When finished the person to the right of the dealer cuts the cards. The cut must leave at least four cards in each portion of the deck. Once the cards have been cut, no further shuffling is allowed.

The 36 Tarabish cards are dealt in groups of three beginning to the left of the dealer and proceeding clockwise until all the cards are passed out. The four players look at their first six cards; the last three, called the kitty, remain face down until after the bid is complete and a trump suit has been chosen.

Cards value
The cards have a strict point value in trumps:

J = 20 points
9 = 14 points
A = 11 points
10 = 10 points
K = 4 point
Q = 3 point
8 7 6 = no value
The order and value in a non-trump suit are:

A = 11 points
10 = 10 points
K = 4 points
Q = 3 points
J = 2 points
9 8 7 6 = no value

227181.name: Lewt Ninja
227181.description:
Description from the publisher:

Lewt Ninja is a standalone card game that challenges 2 - 5 players to become Epic Fantasy Heroes and find treasure, weapons, armour, and Artifacts from the many monsters they encounter. But beware! Every Hero is out only for themselves and will try to swindle the winnings away from you and the rest of your group. Build your lootstash and take what is yours and theirs before they do. Are you ambitious enough to be the Lewt Ninja!

The game Lewt Ninja includes

1 Monster Deck – The monster deck consists of 40 unique monsters and Boss monsters, players draw monster cards during the beginning of their turn. Each monster card will direct players to draw loot cards or additional monster cards. Some monster cards will have special rules that will effect players and prevent different player actions from being used during the round

1 Loot Deck – The loot deck consists of 58 treasure, weapons, and armor cards. Players will find their heroes armor sets and legendary weapons along with other many treasures needed to collect in order to win the game.

1 Player Deck – The Player deck consists of 81 action cards; inside players will find Roll cards used to bid on the loot dropped by monsters. Roll cards have numeric values that simulate dice rolls, the player with the highest roll wins the treasure being rolled on. Along with the roll cards players will also find System and Player Action cards, these cards are used by players to stop players from rolling on treasure or steal treasure away from other players.

10 Player Mats – The player mats included with Lewt Ninja are 10 different heroes that players will assume the role of during game. Players can play as either a Mystic, Wizard, Holy Monk, Ranger, or Shield Knight. There are 2 versions of each hero that allow players to play as same class during gameplay. Each of the classes have special abilities that can be unlocked by obtaining their heroes magic armor. These abilities can be used by a player when they begin the round

To play Lewt Ninja have each player pick one of the hero class characters. Once everyone has picked a hero remove any armor set cards from the loot deck for any hero classes not in the game. Shuffle the 3 decks and place them in the center of the play area; deal out seven player action cards to all players and choose the player turn order.

Lewt Ninja has 3 phases of game play.
At the beginning of the round players will draw one monster from the Monster Deck, this is called Pulling a monster. After pulling the monster the player read aloud the cards rule to everyone; players will then either draw a Loot Card or additional monster card.

The second phase of the round called Looting; the player who started the round will draw the number of Loot cards indicated on the card. Players will then play their Roll cards for the treasure dropped by the monster. If more than one loot card has been drawn players will roll only on one item at a time. Roll cards are placed face down and only revealed once everyone has played a card. The player with the highest roll card wins the treasure.

Phase three, the Ninja phase is final phase of the round. During this phase players can play any of the System or Player Action cards to steal away treasure or protect treasure they have won during the round. Some System and Player Action cards can be played at any time allowing player to block other players from rolling during the looting phase or other actions like visit the traveling merchant to buy treasure by selling back won treasure to the loot deck.

Once the round has been completed all players will draw a new card from the player deck and move to the next player in the turn order.

To win the game players must collect all 8 pieces of their armor, winning all a pieces is an automatic win the game. Should a hero lose any pieces of the armor to another player they still have a chance to win. Players will then need to steel away armor from other players and collect all of the loot cards they can. Once the final loot card has been one the player who has the most loot is the winner.

Lewt Ninja also has two other game modes

Legendary Mode:
In this mode of the game Players will not only need to win their 8 armor piece set but will need to also win their classes legendary weapon.

Vote to Kick
Remove all of the all non-set loot from the Loot Deck. The object of Vote to Kick is to eliminate players from the game by stealing their Armor Set pieces. A Player is eliminated from the game when another player owns 3 pieces of the other player's class armor.

227183.name: Doriath
227183.description:
The wizard Elidaan the Loremaster descends into the underground labyrinth of Doriath in search of the immortality-granting Coronet of Arien, which was crafted by the Lord of Time, Atelan, and thrown into the abyss after he was spurned by the object of his affection, Fianna.

Doriath is a side-view action-adventure platform game set in the vast underground maze of Doriath, which the player explores in non-linear fashion by controlling the player character, a wizard. Basic movement (running and jumping) is handled with the joystick. Spells are used by holding down on the joystick and pressing the fire button. The ultimate goal of the game is to retrieve the Coronet; in order to do so, the player must find the eight pieces of the Riddlescroll of Wurslea, which, when assembled, will show the Coronet’s location. In addition, the player has a wisdom meter which they must increase to 100% by acquiring various useful items hidden throughout the caverns. Many of these items will expand the player’s abilities, particularly the amulets that teach the player spells. There are also dragons guarding some of the items that serve as rudimentary boss monsters and require specific spells to defeat. The player can also heal and protect themselves to various effect by drinking several types of potions (created from ingredients found in the labyrinth), as well as pick up various keys to get through different kinds of locked doors. The player selects items in their inventory with the F1 key, and uses them by pressing F7.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doriath_%28video_game%29 Doriath (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

227184.name: Voidspanners
227184.description:
From the introduction:

Voidspanners is a setting supplement for the Basic Fantasy Role Playing game. This setting includes new rules, classes, monsters, and several exotic locations to provide swashbuckling interplanetary adventure.

227185.name: Der kluge Sparer
227185.description:
Each player gets an bank account and pocket money. There is also a joint account. Each player has to get from space 1 to space 120 (Raiffeisen symbol). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players, mostly by gaining or losing money. The first player to reach space 120 gets half of the joint account, the next one half of the rest and so on. The player with the most money wins the game.

The playing money pictures Deutsche Mark banknotes that were first issued 1961 and 1963.

227186.name: Fantasy Warplay Adult League
227186.description:
User summary:

Characters in this game are generally built around combat prowess. Most of the rules are devoted to combat preparation, support, or execution activities. Magic spells are supported with a "thrown packet" mechanic. Characters select a class which proscribes and directs the build and future improvements.

227189.name: Sugar Rush
227189.description: Created in response to an almost-four-year-old's request for a board game based on her favourite movie, Sugar Rush is a relatively simple racing game designed for children, based thematically on the fictional video game Sugar Rush, from the Disney movie Wreck-it Ralph. Players assume the role of a racer, setup at the starting line, and then take turns rolling dice for their movement around the race track. Each racer has a unique ability that they can charge-up during the race and then use to their advantage. Racers can also gain Power Ups, which are drawn from a randomized deck of Power Up cards. First across the finish line gets 8 Gold Coins, second place gets 5 Gold coins, and third place gets 2 Gold coins. The racer with the most coins at the end wins.

227190.name: King Cat
227190.description:
Description from the designer:

The only game for people who LOVE cats & for people who HATE cats!

This strategic game pits teams of Cat lovers and Cat haters against each other. Each team will draw cards to move the Cat in (Lovers) or kick him out (Haters), and use Super Powers to beat their opponents to the task.

However, during each turn, the Cat has a chance to choose his own action, like refusing to move at all.

227191.name: RPG Journal
227191.description:
User summary:

This item presents a series of template pages that can be used to record game session data. It is intended for print-and-play use.

227192.name: The Language System Thingy
227192.description:
User summary:

This concise document presents an alternate system for language use that allows a gradation of verbal ability in foreign languages.

227196.name: Raiders of the Great Wastelands
227196.description:
Tactical board game in the world of post-apocalypse. Groups of raiders fight for the last treasures of the fallen world. Game for 2-4 players for 40-80 minutes.

This game can show you the life on the ruins of the mankind. You are gonna be a real bad guy. Gangs of marauders, slavers, seductive hatters, insane scientists, wild cyborgs and cool wenches on bikes.

Every player leads one of six gangs with own deck of cards. Sides are asymmetrical with unique play style.

In this game you grab loot and then capture locations with weapons, fuel, water, wreckages and different services. The one who got more loot and unique resources wins.

227198.name: Uncle Figgy's Guide to Roleplaying for Non-Roleplayers: A Manual for Parents, Friends, and Gamers
227198.description:
From the introduction:

You have a friend at school who tells you she can't go out on Saturday because she's "gaming". You ask her if she means Monopoly or poker or something like that and she tells you that no, she's "roleplaying -- it's sort of like Dungeons and Dragons". You've heard stories about kids worshiping the devil or committing suicide because of games like that, so naturally you're concerned.

Or maybe you're a parent and your twelve-year-old son has just come home from a weekend at his friend's house raving about a neat new game his friend's older brother introduced him to in which there is no board, no cards and very few rules but lots of strange dice. All the action takes place in your imagination, he tells you, and he was playing a priest of the god Essun or something like that and he used spells to kill evil monsters. You've heard of something like this involved with psychopathic killers so you're genuinely concerned about your child.

Or maybe you've been playing roleplaying games (RPGs) for a little while and your parents are asking a lot of questions that you're not prepared to answer. That is what this Uncle Figgy's Guide is for: To allay your fears about your friend's well-being or your child's mental health, or to help you discuss the nature of RPGs with your family and friends.

227199.name: Uncle Figgy's Guide to Good Roleplaying, or... How to Make Your Minor Deity Earn His Pay
227199.description:
From the introduction:

I wrote this as a "sequel", if you will, to Uncle Figgy's Guide to Good Game Mastering. I realized (after it was all done with, of course) that there are always tips for how a person can be a better Game Master, but very few on how a person can be a better player. And that's why I decided to write this guide.

In so doing, I make the assumption that the reader has more than just a passing familiarity with roleplaying. That he or she has roleplayed in the past, knows the important terms and concepts, and is now looking to be a better player. As such, Uncle Figgy's Guide to Good Roleplaying really isn't for the person seeking to learn the basics of roleplaying, but more for the player who has mastered the basics and now seeks to go farther.

227200.name: Uncle Figgy's Guide to Good GameMastering, or... How to Manipulate Friends and Influence People
227200.description:
From the introduction:

I love roleplaying. For me, RPGs go way beyond the "G" part of their name. They're not just roleplaying "games", but a way of hobbyist life as serious as any fly-fisherman, sports fan/player or model railroad enthusiast. The problem is that very few people feel that way. Some say they do, but it's apparent through their actions that they don't; someone who truly loves something will always look for ways to be better at it. Most of the GMs I've played with, however, think they're "good enough" and if you don't like it, leave. So I do, because a roleplaying game exists for the benefit of both the GM and the player. And because of my love for roleplaying, I'm offering this online manual, free and without cost, to whosoever wishes to read it and possibly benefit from the experience contained herein.

227201.name: Lucha Liga
227201.description:
From the introduction:

A masked fighter steps into the ring, ready to pound his opponent senseless. The crowd cheers wildly, waiting to see a sensational signature move. And who is behind the mysterious contender, calling the shots and planning the battle? You! Enter the world of Lucha Liga, the simple RPG that makes you the manager of your very own team of luchadores!

227202.name: Lucha Liga: Luchador Lineup
227202.description:
Publisher's lineup:

The Luchador Lineup presents seventeen wrestlers, stated up and ready for use in any game of Lucha Liga. Some are heroic, some are sinister, but they all include two attacks and color portaits of their masked costumes.

The included wrestlers are El Arquitecto, BaBy Q, Blue Smoke, Disco Duck, Gourdo, Icy Cone Man, El Luchacabra, Midnight, Mr. Right, Prickly Pierre, Punch Drunk, Red Panda, Regen, Santa Buena, Torta Diablo, Uno, and Vato Gato.

Use them for inspiration for your own original wrestlers or drop them into the ring to battle your players!

227203.name: Lucha Liga: Hall of Fame Heroes
227203.description:
Publisher's lineup:

A wrestling museum offers an open invitation tournament with the coveted Belt of the Snake as the grand prize. It's the perfect place for a luchador manager who's just starting out to make a name for himself! But unexpected danger may lurk in the shadows...

Hall of Fame Heroes is a prepared introductory adventure for Lucha Liga. Included are a scenario, a map, and four wrestlers stated out. Use it as a starting point for a longer game or as a one shot.

227204.name: Bacon Run
227204.description:
User's Summary:

You're a group of anthropomorphic pigs dumped on an island, being chased by anthropomorphic wolf hunters - who want to kill and eat you - through a variety of areas. Best part. This is entertainment for the world to watch. Who will be the sole survivor?

This game was a submission in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

227205.name: Become the Media
227205.description:
User's Summary:

Find the Truth and write investigation news article in 6 steps. Players take the roles of investigative journalists trying to find the truth about a subject.

This game was a submission in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

227206.name: The Missing Children of Triel
227206.description:
From the introduction:

The small town of Triel is a lovely little growing place. A noble Elven family moved here years ago and spurred a growth that had never been seen, then one day, they disappeared. The only remnants of the family are the husk of a building left on the hill to the north side of town, and the farms that still operate in the city, pushing growth forward. Mysterious events had taken place years ago, then stopped with the disappearance of the royal family. Now they’ve begun again. With five local children missing, it’s the adventurer’s job to figure out where they’ve gone and who might be responsible.

A 4-5 hour adventure for 5th level characters.

User summary:

This scenario is distributed with separate image files (maps).

227207.name: Black Gate
227207.description:
User's Summary:

One character is dead and in hell and one character is alive and trying get through 7 challenges. You could be lovers, family, friends or rivals, but the character in hell is trying to get out and help the living player achieve his goals. This game tells the stories of their trials.

This game was a submission in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

227208.name: Bloodhound - A Detective RPG
227208.description:
User's Summary:

Bloodhound is a 2 player RPG, inspired by series with criminal protagonists and law enforcement antagonists, like Dexter, Hannibal and Death Note. The law enforcement characters must track down and capture the criminal.

This game was a submission in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

227209.name: Bluebeard's Bride's Daughter's Psychiatrist
227209.description:
User's Summary:

Bluebeard's Bride's Daughter's personality is shattered and broken. Bluebeard's Bride's Daughter's psychiatrist must find some way to help her. One random player takes the role of psychiatrist and the others take on the role of Bluebeard's Bride's Daughter's personality.

This game was a submission in the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016.

227210.name: The Giant's Trove
227210.description:
From the introduction:

Tales tell of a powerful item that can command legions hidden in a Stone Giant’s lair. Will the adventurers find it before another band of marauders, or be stopped by another sinister force — the gnolls?

A 2-hour adventure for 3rd-5th level characters.

227211.name: Race for the Golden Pig
227211.description:
From the introduction:

After being teleported to a rocky outcropping, two groups of adventurers must now race to “Touch the Golden Pig”.

A 3-4 hour adventure for 2 groups of 4-6 1st level characters.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as an 8-Page PDF file and eleven JPG map files.

227212.name: For Glory
227212.description:
Description from the designer:

For Glory is a deck-building game for 2-4 players that puts players into the role of gladiator school owners in ancient Rome. Each player uses money and influence in order to develop a team of gladiators with the hopes of gaining the most glory in the arena.

The game is split into rounds, each of which is split into two phases. During the machinations phase, players acquire cards to build their decks, and play cards to develop their schools. These cards consist of gladiators, schemes, tactics, and assets which are all used in unique ways to help the player's school gain money, influence, and ultimately glory in the arena. Each turn, a player can either buy a card from the supply, or play a card from his or her hand.

During the arena phase, gladiators which were acquired during the machinations phase fight for their schools in the arena in a bloody contest where only one side survives. Gladiators have attack, HP, and agility stats which determine how much damage they deal, how much punishment they can take, and the order in which they act, respectively. They also each possess a unique ability which can be combined with the abilities of other gladiators to get an edge in combat.

Winning a battle not only provides a player with glory, but also with a boast card to gain even more glory in future rounds. If players aren't careful, boasting could very well reduce their ability to win future battles. The winner is the first player to a certain number of glory points.

227213.name: Dead Vault Descent (5E)
227213.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Still seeking a way home, your heroes use their newfound knowledge and a daring heist from the dangerous Thanex Coterie to reactivate a long dormant interplanetary gate. Traveling to the lost world of Kylorn, a tidally locked planet half scorched by eternal sunshine, half frozen by endless darkness, they must descend into the dead vaults beneath the planet’s surface and travel from the frozen dark side of the planet through the picturesque sunset lands to the burning inferno of the scorching Daylands in search of Kylorn’s primary portal. Along the way, they must face lethal sentient automatons and deathless undead legions locked in a perpetual war for centuries, while shapeshifting assassins, powerful guardians, and the deadly extremes of the planet itself promise death or glory to the PCs on their Dead Vault Descent!

User summary:

For 8th - 10th level characters.

227214.name: Island of Heroes
227214.description: Island of Heroes is a tactical-level game of Sino-Soviet border conflict in Zhenbao Island, 1969. One player commands People's Liberation Army, another player Soviet border guards.

227215.name: Christopher Clark's Bastion: The Border Village of Namar
227215.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mini-campaign sourcebook, in detail, set in the north woods. Includes two adventures and an entire town intended for use as the basis for a campaign. Personalities, drama, politics, and power struggles, its all here!

Intended for use either as a stand-alone campaign sourcebook or in conjunction with the Forest of Deceit adventure series: Forest of Deceit, Strange Allies, and The Hidden Prince.

227216.name: Inner Worlds: Love, Politics, and Role-Playing Games
227216.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Does it sometimes seem that nothing is OK?
Are you fed up of being made to feel guilty?
Do you just want to enjoy games without all the politics?

In these eight essays on social interaction, ­politics, ­magic, ­mental health, conflict and sex in ­role-playing games, game designer ­Howard Ingham talks around the politics and ethics of creating fictional people in games, and affirms that yes, it’s OK.

227221.description: Click Click Boom is a bluffing game of Russian Roulette, where a group of western animals compete for the most money. Use special character abilities, cunning, trickery, and psychology to figure out who is trying to take you out...so you can ultimately win the pot of money at the end of the game.
227221.name: Click Click Boom

227222.name: Kill Hitler
227222.description:
A card game for 2-4+ players set in the period 1940-45. Players represent various elements of the German Resistance trying to assassinate Hitler.

Through card play players strive to be the first player to assassinate Hitler.

Players share a common deck comprising 6 card types:
Method (Plot Card. Weapons used in an attempt)
Conspirator (Plot Card. Key Personnel involved)
Venue (Plot Card. Exact Building or Location the Fuhrer is currently in)
Locale (Plot Card. City or Region the Fuhrer is currently in)
Save (Events that Prevent an assassination)
Action (Events with Special effects)

To set-up the deck is shuffled and each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards.
Players take turns with each turn having 5 phases:
1. Fate Phase
- Draw 1 card from the deck and put it in your hand.
2. Plot Phase
- You may put 1 or more plot cards into play face up in front of you.
- A Complete Plot consists of 1 of each of the 4 different types of Plot Cards: Method, Conspirator, Venue, Locale.
3. Foil Phase
- Any opponent may play (discard) 1 or more save cards.
A save card causes the target indicated plot card to be discarded. You may immediately play a plot card from your hand to replace the card eliminated by the save card.
4. Kill Phase
- If you have complete plot in play, roll 1 die for each of the 4 plot cards. (This is called the assassination attempt).
For each odd number you roll, discard 1 plot card. If all the rolls are even, the attempt is a success, you have killed Hitler, and you win the game.
5. End Phase
- Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards.

If Hitler is not killed after the players have gone through the deck twice then Hitler survives, the German Resistance is crushed, and all the players lose.

227223.name: Ashen
227223.description:
User Summary

Ashen is an open world survival, combat and exploration based videogame.

227224.name: The Red Cathedral
227224.description:
The Red Cathedral is a medium-weight strategy eurogame about the building of the St. Basil's Cathedral on Moscow in the XVI century.

You have to pick to pick 1 action out 4 possibles:


Secure a section of the Cathedral
You will build this section and for that you're rewarded with the chance of expanding your workshop with bonus tiles and/or helpers.




Go to the market
Move one die from the dice rondel and get the resources depicted. Also, activate any bonus tile and/or helper that you have linked to the dice you choose.




Send materials
Send up to 3 resources to a section in construction. If you finish it, you will be rewarded with money and experience.




Play a helper
Pay its cost in money and place it in your workshop.



Whenever you have constructed all of your possible sections, the game ends.

The Red Cathedral is a fast paced medium eurogame when you're building the St. Basil's Cathedral at the same time you develop the best workshop of the entire country.

Expected Kickstarter at the end of 2017.

227225.name: Tonka Construction
227225.description:
User Summary

Welcome to Tonka Land, where your child can use Tonka trucks to work on realistic construction projects. Dig for treasure in the Quarry and work on roads in the Desert and the Mountains. Build projects in the City --- choose from a park, a skyscraper, or a castle. In the Garage, you can repair, paint, and then drive the trucks away.

227226.name: Rosemary West's House of Fortunes
227226.description:
User Summary

Visiting the House of Fortunes at night, the player registers in a book his/her arrival along with other visitors. Rosemary welcomes the player and proposes five kinds of predictions of his/her fortune in a playable, interactive manner.

227227.name: Redemption City
227227.description:
After the apocalypse, the Earth is all but destroyed, save for the last city. The few remaining humans who were neither good enough for Heaven nor evil enough for Hell are stuck in limbo, held on Earth. Angels and Demons wage war against each other across the universe, trying to gain control where they can. They care not for the humans in limbo, for their souls won’t ever be released to them. As the Earth is removed of most humans, nature has decided to take back what is left, to consume the land with their plants once more.

The final Battle for earth begins!


This is a strategy game for 2 - 5 players, where you build your base, gain resources, and send units to build or attack.

The game takes place on a 10 by 10 grid, with each player choosing a race, then placing them at the relevant starting location (dependent on the number of players). Each player then takes it in turns to spawn units, take two actions for each unit (move, build or attack), constructing buildings that will either give them money (for building and upgrades), weapon tokens (for attacking and defending) for creating more units (for making actions). Players can build in an empty space, so long as they have the resources, however if the space has an enemy building, they can attack+build (redemption!) to create a building of one level higher than that attacked (for the cost of a lower level building). After each player has taken a turn, you roll for obstacles (Meteorites, etc) which can land anywhere and destroy buildings, whilst also being "Redeemed" by players to give them an easy higher level building.

Each race has their own goal, such as to own the majority of the board, along with a unique ability that aids them in this goal.

Once a player has reached this goal, they win the game after one more round.

227228.name: The Dwarves of Copper Gulch
227228.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Dwarves of Copper Gulch have returned! They seem to be a bit less industrious than before and you will have to figure out why. This is a Swords and Wizardry Compatible Adventure for levels 1-3.

227231.name: Magma Giant
227231.description:
From publisher blurb:

"If you don’t understand why we did it, you’ve never been in a Fire Giant slave camp.

"Imagine living your life contented in a village, when the Fire Giant armies come rolling in. They destroy the walls, murder your neighbors, and eventually round up your family to work in the mines. 14 hours a day in the blistering underground heat, digging up the precious gems and minerals that fuel their war machine. If you drop from exhaustion, your fellows have to leave you there, or else you both get kicked into the magma to burn. You’d want to destroy them too.

"So you sneak a few of those precious stones into your quarters after your shift. While the halfling keeps watch at the door, the elves assemble the rocks into a giant’s likeness. The dwarves inscribe runes in the right places, and the druids provide a dark blessing. And suddenly, the creature you’ve built sits up and glows a brighter red than the lava under your feet.

"How were we supposed to know it wouldn’t stop with the Fire Giants? We cheered as the immense heat increased its power, enough to tear down the hidden city. But then it ripped through the slave quarter, tearing off its own rocky flesh to use as flaming boulders. I barely managed to escape before it shattered through a fault line and collapsed the entire coast.

"We did what we did. I’m not sorry for it, no matter how much your judges leer at me. But I promise you this: We just made one.

"Only the Gods know why Magma Giants now roam the land."

227232.description:
Expansion n. 2.5 for Drizzit: il gioco di carte.

It contains several cards that were previously released as print&play.

It includes:
3 new Characters with their Powers and Equipments,
7 alternative versions of previous Characters,
3 Muses,
2 Crystal cards,
5 alternative Bosses.

With this expansion, customers also obtain a booklet with strategic tips for the game and the first 80 strips of the comic, redrawed.
227232.name: Drizzit: Il gioco di carte – Personaggi e Poteri (più altre carte fichissime)

227233.name: Ma Zaan
227233.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World of Myrr (MEER) was inspired by the classic fantasy RPG settings. Ma Zaan is the second of nine continents in Myrr. It is a highly detailed, 167 page book. This can be used for 5th Edition adventures and can be used with other fantasy RPGs. More than thirty players have playtested this setting for over three years.

Dwarves, Dukes, and Devilfolk! Discover the turbulent homeland of the dwarves, tieflings, and dragonborn. Tumultuous volcanic activity and earthquakes are a part of life in Ma Zaan. A brutal war also rages between the dwarves and tieflings...and the evil horned ones are winning! The dragonborn have been enslaved and there is infighting among the dwarves.

The 167 page book includes:

Over 18 detailed settlements (villages, towns, and cities)
Unique lore, with a timeline included
More than 60 new monsters
Adventure hooks
Detailed map of the continent
Detailed geographic features
A unique pantheon with over 19 deities
Over 40 different factions
More than 25 pages of encounter tables
More than 25 pages of corresponding monster lists, organized by challenge ratings
New magic items
Over 90 detailed inns and taverns
Tavern menu list

227234.name: Small Foes
227234.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product presents a variety of foes to pitch against your heroes. Within, you will find:

The Awanhondo, an insect from the spirit world with a rather shocking sting.
The diminutive and mysterious Bucca, skilled miners of the deepest deep who just want to be left alone.
The Gem Eater, a short construct that will steal and consume your best gemstones if you're not careful.
The Grimli are short, independent and amenable constructs that enjoy working with friendly neighbors -- just don't attack them or you'll see they are tougher than they look.

227235.name: Victory's Vault Volume 2, Issue 08
227235.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

The "good" Miss Cindy Wondderra claims to be the keeper of the vaults of a Corporation that deals solely in Victory, and in the pages of Victory's Vault, she offers these items to adventurers and villains alike at remarkable prices! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Miss Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

227236.name: Amazon (Pathfinder)
227236.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gostor: Amazon presents a new playable race that allows you to delve into the mystical and sacred feminine these idealized women represent. Human, but set apart from human communities because they are blessed -and cursed - by the gods.

Players will find a new race and new feats. GMs will find ideas to introduce and use amazons in your own campaign setting, with adventure hooks and notes on how amazons fit into other campaign settings.

227237.name: Twenty Quick Dragonborn NPCs
227237.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do your players catch you out sometimes by suddenly expressing an interest in some random NPC who you never planned out because they weren't important? Do you sometimes struggle to come up with names for all the NPCs you are populating your setting with?

Either way this document will help!

Twenty NPCs described in just enough detail to make them quick to insert or adapt as needed.

227238.name: Twenty Quick Halfling NPCs
227238.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do your players catch you out sometimes by suddenly expressing an interest in some random NPC who you never planned out because they weren't important? Do you sometimes struggle to come up with names for all the NPCs you are populating your setting with?

Either way this document will help!

Twenty NPCs described in just enough detail to make them quick to insert or adapt as needed.

227239.name: Gorean Adventures: The Silver Cult
227239.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Silver Cult thrusts the characters into a conspiracy that threatens to overturn the natural order of Gor and the city of Tharna. Will they side with the revolutionaries who seek to usurp the power of that city, or help crush the rebellion?

This supplement also contains rules for slave-breaking and torture, and for encouraging better roleplay through mechanics.

Ta Sardar Gor!

227240.name: Volcanic Sacrifical Pit
227240.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 352nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a site for ritual sacrifices at the edge of a volcano.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

227241.name: Dead Tree Fort
227241.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 351st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a fort built into the hollowed out stump of a gigantic tree.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

227242.name: The Silk Road
227242.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Trek across thousands of miles of adventure.
For centuries, East met West along the Silk Road. With GURPS Hot Spots: The Silk Road, this time and place comes alive for your campaigns, with details about the region's people, food, religions, languages, and architecture. Travel with rare goods through bandit country, navigate micro-wars for dominance, or quest for holy lore and artifacts. Use The Silk Road and its included maps in your historical campaigns . . . or blend it with other GURPS genres, from Dungeon Fantasy to Horror and beyond!

227243.name: The Elder God Diary 5/11
227243.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jimmy goes looking for The Amulet of Dusk...

227244.name: The Elder God Diary 6/11
227244.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jimmy goes to see what the bad guys are capable of...

227245.name: The Elder God Diary 7/11
227245.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this map, Jimmy has to go retrieve the diary because someone lost it...

227246.name: The Elder God Diary 8/11
227246.description:
From the introduction:

They've had a powwow and decided the best thing to do - actually the only thing to do - is assassinate the main buy. Whilse I do that they are going to study the diary.

227247.description: This 7-card promo pack includes Captain Bluebeard, Catbeard the Pirate, Firestarter Kelly, Jellybeans, La Capitán, Ninja, and the Vampirate.
227247.name: Scuttle!: Promo Pack

227248.name: Fantasy Election
227248.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mini election game for your campaign - Decide the balance of power in your favorite campaign city by holding an election. A fun new game mechanic.

227249.name: Cursed Magic Items
227249.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An expanded gameplay mechanic for cursed items - Curse items are a great opportunity for roleplay and player experience. Curses for every level of play, and a new magic item.

227250.name: Sewers
227250.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ten urban sewer encounters - Ten random encounters in the sewers beneath your urban setting. Includes 10 encounters, 30 adventure hooks, and two new monsters.

227251.name: Non-Player Character Sampler
227251.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Five free 5e NPCs for your campaign - A sample set of five NPCs, including 15 adventure hooks, 3 new alchemical items, a new god, and a recipe for medieval tarts (yes, seriously).

227252.name: Forest 2
227252.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More evil lurks in the woodlands - Our second set of random encounters in a Forest setting. Comes with 10 encounters, 30 adventure hooks, and a new monster.

227253.name: Coast
227253.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ten coastal / aquatic encounters - Ten random encounters along the coastline of the sea. Comes with 10 encounters, 30 adventure hooks, and two new magic items.

227254.name: Hafid's Grand Bazaar
227254.description:
Bid, haggle, and trade your way to the top in this raucous trading game of set collection and player negotiation for 2 to 6 players.

Acquire spices, textiles, livestock and other exotic goods by bidding on caravans from foreign markets across the ancient world. Manipulate the market – and each other – using your shrewd bargaining skills to trade with your fellow merchants and collect resource sets to maximize profits.

The game is played in a series of rounds based on the number of players. Each round consists of four phases during which players will take turns bidding on caravans, influence, and customers; collecting goods from caravans; trading and negotiating with each other to collect sets of goods; and selling their goods for maximum profit. Goods are divided into 5 categories, with 5 different items in each category. Players can see which categories of goods their opponents are holding by the symbols on the backs of the cards, but do not know the specific item the cards represent in those categories.

This isn't your typical trading game and player interaction can get raucous and intense as players get creative with their haggling! The player with the highest value of talent coins at the end of the game wins. The marketplace is dynamic and ever-changing. You will need to stay sharp and engaged to amass the most wealth and become the greatest merchant in Hafid’s Grand Bazaar!

227255.name: Limitless Encounters Volume 1
227255.description:
Publisher's blurb:

150 encounters in 12 different environments - Gathering up our most popular sellers in one book. OGL stat blocks for all monsters, and creative CR appropriate treasure.

User summary:

A compilation of previously-published materials from the series, including items taken from:


Limitless Encounters: Arctic
Limitless Encounters: Desert
Dungeon Encounters
Limitless Encounters: Forest
Limitless Encounters: Grasslands
Haunted Locales
Limitless Encounters: Hill
Limitless Encounters: Mountain
Orc Hordes

227256.name: Dime Adventures: Character Sheets
227256.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A staple for any player or GM, these character sheets come in both form-fillable and standard PDF versions.

User summary:

The sheet is a single-sided, one-page, full-color, print-and-play component.

227257.description:
The Napoleonic 20 Expansion Kit includes these new, optional Expansion Kit component modules:


18 C'est la Guerre cards
12 Maneuver Matrix cards and the "approach to battle" system
8 Great Captains cards
Chief-of-Staff system with new replacement Leader units
½ Morale Points system making this system realistically more granular
Expanded Victory Conditions
Strategic Pursuit system


Hanau 20 is a smaller, more "introductory" in size, game of the Napoleonic 20 series, which sees the curtain fall on the campaigns of 1813 as Napoleon was withdrawing from his defeat at the great Battle of Leipzig a fortnight earlier. Although it was not a large battle, it was a vital one, as Napoleon suddenly found his retreat route back to France blocked by an unexpected, newly raised Allied force.
227257.name: Napoleonic 20 Expansion Kit (with Hanau 20)

227263.name: Animal Village
227263.description: Animal Village is a worker-placement style game played solely with cards in which players try to cultivate both crops and sheep to score points.

227264.description: 60 card pack of Nightmare Decks for the three scenarios contained in The Land of Shadow Saga Expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game.
227264.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Land of Shadow Nightmare Decks
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

227265.name: Kleiner Fuchs Tierarzt
227265.description:
Game description from the publisher:
It's a very busy day at the tree house doctor's office! The hedgehog has a cold, the bat sprained its wing and the rabbit bumped its head. Help the little fox veterinarian treat his patients correctly. To do this you need a bit of luck with the dice. Who can be the first to treat 5 different animals? Based on developer and publisher Fox & Sheep's children's mobile application of the same title.

227266.name: Wagon Wheels
227266.description:
Description from the publisher:

Wagon Wheels is a nano-sized game by Nat Levan, based on Circle The Wagons. Nat has been making these Nanodaptions (trademark!) of our already small wallet games, where he will distill the essence of the gameplay down to just a few cards and tokens. Wagon Wheels is just 3 cards, which includes 4 different maps and one rules card.

In the game, two players will place and move their tokens around the map, trying to get the majority of their tokens in a quadrant to score that quadrant's special bonus as well as trying to get the east and west spaces on the map for additional points.

227267.name: Vermin Vendetta
227267.description:
A backyard is a war-zone for bugs that are in search of food. Take control of a faction of bugs in an all out war fighting to gain the most food.

Each faction has variable powers and cards which makes each faction you choose play very differently. As the game progresses you will build up your deck using DNA to gain some more powerful abilities through the cards you buy allowing you to move and attack with your various bug types. Then food will allow you to gain more DNA as well as spawning more units onto the board.

Position yourself properly and kill off enough your opponents units to be the one with the most food at the end to win.

227269.name: Run Away
227269.description:
User Summary

Six teens from college are going to spend an unforgettable weekend in a country house. But they do not even know what they will have to go through...

227270.name: The Slopes
227270.description:
User Summary

Don’t wait for winter to hit The Slopes.

227271.name: Demon's Crystals
227271.description:
Demon's Crystals is a frenetic twin stick shooter where you guide the Urican demons through countless hazards in order to restore peace to the world. A variety of weapons and power-ups will help you defeat the massive enemy hordes.

Source: The Developer Website.

227273.name: Cosmogenesis
227273.description: In a game of Cosmogenesis, each player will create their own planet system, starting from a star and an asteroid belt. In order to do this, they will use the elements available on the different sections of the central board. In each round, players will obtain one element from each of the 4 sections over 4 turns and with these elements players will form planets and moons. These will collide with each other causing them to increase in size, develop rings, form atmospheres and of course create life. Players will do all of this in order to fulfill their own objectives, which like the rest of the elements of the game, will be obtained from the central board, and that at the end of the game, will provide the victory points that will determine the overall winner.

227274.name: Bendy and the Ink Machine - Chapter One: Moving Pictures
227274.description:
"Bendy and the Ink Machine™" is the first person puzzle action horror game that will forever ruin your childhood love of cartoons.

The player plays as Henry, an animator, who gets an invitation to his old workplace, an animation workshop called Joey Drew Studios, by the owner of the studio, Joey Drew. Upon arriving, the place seems deserted, and ran through with large ink pipes. Upon exploring, Henry finds the titular Ink Machine, as well as evidence that Joey began dabbling with the occult, finding a mutilated corpse of Boris the Wolf, one of the cartoon characters appearing in Joey's cartoon posters. He searches around the workshop to find six items needed to power the machine: a manual, a Bendy plush, a cog, a record, a wrench, and an inkwell.

Source: The Game Website.

227275.name: Bendy and the Ink Machine - Chapter Two: The Old Song
227275.description:
"Bendy and the Ink Machine™" is the first person puzzle action horror game that will forever ruin your childhood love of cartoons.

When awakening, Henry begins to find more evidence of Joey and Musical Director Sammy Lawrence, who wears a mask of Bendy and appears to be covered in ink. Seemingly trapped in the studio, Lawrence went insane and began to worship Bendy as a form of appeasement, believing the cartoon devil to be a literal demon. Henry ends up in the Music Department of the studio, following clues through tape recordings to find his way out. While trying to escape he encounters The Searchers, blobs of ink that form themselves into humanoid figures and try to attack him.

Source: The Game Website.

227276.name: Bendy and the Ink Machine - Chapter Three:
227276.description:
